required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Recombinant HIV-1 Envelope Protein BG505 SOSIP.GT1.1 gp140 Vaccine, Adjuvanted in Healthy, HIV-uninfected Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blinded, Placebo-controlled, Dose-escalation Phase 1 Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of Recombinant HIV-1 Envelope Protein BG505 SOSIP.GT1.1 gp140 Vaccine, Adjuvanted in Healthy, HIV-uninfected Adults

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1 clinical trial to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of HIV-1 envelope protein BG505 SOSIP.GT1.1 gp140 trimer Vaccine, Adjuvanted, in up to 48 healthy HIV-uninfected adult volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a phase 1 clinical trial to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of HIV-1 envelope protein BG505 SOSIP.GT1.1 gp140 trimer Vaccine, Adjuvanted, in up to 48 healthy HIV-uninfected adult volunteers. BG505 SOSIP.GT1.1 is a soluable, cleavage-competent, trimeric HIV-1 envelope glycoprotein gp140 formulated in 0.55mL at 2mg/mL in 20 mM Tris, 100 mM naCL, pH 7.5 and will be administered IM.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of volunteers with Grade 2 or greater reactogenicity (i.e., solicited adverse events) from Day 0 through Day 7 after each investigational product (IP) administration

primary_outcome.measure: Safety - IP related unsolicited adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of volunteers with IP-related unsolicited adverse events (AEs), including safety laboratory (biochemical, hematological) parameters, from the day of each IP administration up to 28 days post each IP administration

primary_outcome.measure: Safety - Grade 2 or greater unsolicited AEs
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of volunteers with Grade 2 or greater unsolicited adverse events (AEs), including safety laboratory (biochemical, hematological) parameters, from the day of each IP administration up to 28 days post each IP administration
Proportion of volunteers with IP-related serious adverse events (SAEs) throughout the study period
Proportion of volunteers in each group with potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) from the day of first IP administration throughout the study period

secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of binding antibody responses to GT1.1 trimer after the first, second, and/or third IP administrations compared to baseline
Magnitude of binding antibody responses to GT1.1 trimer after the first, second, and/or third IP administrations compared to baseline

intervention.intervention_name: BG505 SOSIP GT1.1 gp140 Vaccine, Adjuvanted
BG505 SOSIP GT1.1 gp140 Vaccine, Adjuvanted
